doc.previous: The walls of the vimana below the dravida superstructure are decorated with simple pilasters in low relief with boldly modeled sculptures between them There are fully decorated surfaces with frequent recesses and projections with deeper niches and conventional sculptures 52 The decoration of the walls is subdued compared to that of the later Hoysala architecture The walls which are broken up into hundreds of projections and recesses produce a remarkable effect of light and shade 52 an artistic vocabulary inherited by the Hoysala builders in the decades that followed 54
